sen.j: 園部藩（そのべはん）は、丹波国船井郡（現在の京都府南丹市園部町小桜町）に存在した藩。
sen.e: The domain of Sonobe is the one which existed in Funai County in the Province of Tamba (Sonobe-cho Kozakura Town, Nantan City, Kyoto Prefecture in the present day).
The domain of Sonobe existed in Funai County in the Tamba Province (Sonobe-cho Kozakura Town, Nantan City, Kyoto Prefecture in the present day).
sen.cmt: Readability, also changed the Province of Tamba to Tamba Province, as per the term list of 8/5.
sen.e: The Sonobe Domain existed in Funai County in Tanba Province (Sonobe-cho Kozakura Town, Nantan City, Kyoto Prefecture in the present day).
sen.cmt: domain of→DomanTamba→Tanbathe Tanba Province の定冠詞 the 不要

sen.j: 園部藩は、元和 (日本)5年（1619年）12月、但馬国出石藩主であった小出吉親が新たに入部してきたことにより立藩した。
sen.e: The domain of Sonobe became independent in December 1619 when Yoshichika KOIDE who was the feudal lord of the domain of Izushi in the Province of Tajima newly entered into the area.
The domain of Sonobe became independent in December 1619 when Yoshichika KOIDE, the feudal lord of the domain of Izushi in the Tajima Province took over.
sen.cmt: 入部 has been translated as "enter" but I think the meaning is closer to "take over" in this context.
sen.e: The domain of Sonobe became independent in December 1619 when Yoshichika KOIDE, the feudal lord of the Izushi Domain in Tajima Province took over.
sen.cmt: domain of→Domanthe Tajima Province の定冠詞 the 不要

sen.j: 所領はおよそ2万9800石ほどである。
sen.e: The territory was approximately 29,800 koku.
The territory had a yield of approximately 29,800 koku in rice.
sen.cmt: Trans 1 does not make any sense in English. Here the 29,800 koku is clearly the yield fro the territory,
sen.e: The territory had a yield of approximately 29,800 koku in rice.

sen.j: 初代藩主・吉親は園部城築城や検地、城下町の建設や治水事業に励んで藩政の基礎を固めた。
sen.e: Yoshichika, the first lord of the domain, confirmed the base of the domain duties as he worked on the construction of Sonobe Castle, land survey, building of the castle town, and flood control.

Yoshichika, the first lord of the domain, strengthened the foundations of the adminstration through construction of Sonobe-jo Castle, implementing a land survey, building the castle town, and implementing flood control measures.

Yoshichika, the first lord of the domain, strengthened the foundations of the administration through construction of Sonobe-jo Castle, implementing a land survey, building the castle town, and implementing flood control measures.

sen.j: 吉親は寛文7年（1667年）6月9日に隠居し、家督は子の小出英知が継いだ。
sen.e: Yoshichika retired on June 9, 1667, and his son Fusatomo KOIDE took over the family estate.
Yoshichika retired on June 9, 1667, and his son Fusatomo KOIDE took over the family estate.
Yoshichika retired on June 9, 1667, and his son Fusatomo KOIDE took over the family estate.

sen.j: このとき、藩領は隠居料として吉親が5000石、英知が新墾田を併せて2万5000石を継ぐこととなった。
sen.e: At that time, Yoshichika took 5,000 koku of the territory of the domain as the retirement benefice and Fusatomo 25,000 koku including new rice fields.
On his retirement, Yoshichika took territory with a yield of 5,000 koku as a retirement benefice and Fusatomo inherited terrritory, including new rice fields, with an overall yield of 25,000 koku.
On his retirement, Yoshichika took territory with a yield of 5,000 koku as a retirement benefice and Fusatomo inherited territory, including new rice fields, with an overall yield of 25,000 koku.

sen.j: 翌年3月11日に吉親が死去すると、その隠居料であった5000石は英知の弟・小出吉直と小出吉忠がそれぞれ3000石と2000石に分割して相続した。
sen.e: When Yoshichika died on March 11 in the next year, his retirement benefice of 5,000 koku was divided and Yoshinao KOIDE and Yoshitada KOIDE, the younger brothers of Fusatomo, inherited 3,000 koku and 2,000 koku respectively.

When Yoshichika died on March 11 the next year, his retirement benefice of 5,000 koku was divided between Yoshinao KOIDE and Yoshitada KOIDE, Fusatomo's younger brothers, who inherited territories with yields of 3,000 koku and 2,000 koku respectively.

When Yoshichika died on March 11 the next year, his retirement benefice of 5,000 koku was divided between Yoshinao KOIDE and Yoshitada KOIDE, Fusatomo's younger brothers, who inherited territories with yields of 3,000 koku and 2,000 koku respectively.

sen.j: 第4代藩主・小出英貞は奏者番、寺社奉行、若年寄を歴任し、次男の小出英治に1000石を分与している。
sen.e: Hidesada KOIDE, the 4th lord of the domain, had held the positions of sojaban, jisha-bugyo responsible for the management of temples and shrines, and wakadoshiyori, and settled 1,000 koku on Hideharu, the second son.

Hidesada KOIDE, the 4th lord of the domain, had held the positions of sojaban (the administrator of the etiquette in the shogunate), jisha-bugyo (the position responsible for the management of temples and shrines), and wakadoshiyori (the commander of Hatamoto/Gokenin (the vassals)), and allocated territory with a yield of 1,000 koku to Hideharu, his second son.
sen.cmt: Since it is not clear what the "sobajan" and "wakadoshiyori" are, the explanations were added. I think it is best just to say that he administrative positions in the shogunate. Also, the source just says Hidesada gave 1000 koku to his second son, but I think that this means he gave his son territory with a yield of 1000 koku.
sen.e: Hidesada KOIDE, the fourth lord of the domain, had held the positions of sojaban (the administrator of etiquette in the shogunate), jisha-bugyo (the position responsible for the management of temples and shrines), and wakadoshiyori (the commander of Hatamoto/Gokenin (the vassals)), and allocated territory with a yield of 1,000 koku to Hideharu, his second son.

sen.j: 第5代藩主・小出英持も英貞と同じくその三職を歴任し、第6代藩主・小出英常は奏者番になるなど、幕府の要職を歴任している。
sen.e: Hidemochi KOIDE, the 5th lord of the domain, had held these three positions as Hidesada did, and Hidetsune KOIDE, the 6th lord of the domain, had held the position of sojaban; they had held the important positions of Shogunate.

The 5th and 6th lords of the domain also held important postions in the Shogunate, with Hidemochi KOIDE, the 5th lord serving in the same three positions as Hidesada, and Hidetsune KOIDE, the 6th lord, holding the position of sobajan.
sen.cmt: I think that the point of the sentence is that the 5th and 6th lords held important positions.
sen.e: The fifth and sixth lords of the domain also held important positions in the Shogunate, with Hidemochi KOIDE, the fifth lord serving in the same three positions as Hidesada, and Hidetsune KOIDE, the sixth lord, holding the position of sobajan.

sen.j: しかし第7代藩主・小出英タケの頃から飢饉や旱魃、洪水などの天災によって藩財政の窮乏化が表面化し、天明7年（1787年）には凶作と米価高騰などから百姓一揆が発生する。
sen.e: However, the devastation of the finance of the domain became clear around the period of Hidetake KOIDE, the 7th lord of the domain, because of the act of nature such as famine, drought, and flood, and bad harvest and a jump in rice price caused a peasant's revolt in 1787.

However, from around the time that Hidetake KOIDE became the 7th lord, the domain was assailed by a series of disasters including famine, drought, and flooding, weaking the finances of the administration, and, in 1787, a bad harvest and jump in rice price caused a peasant's revolt.

However, from around the time that Hidetake KOIDE became the seventh lord, the domain was assailed by a series of disasters including famine, drought, and flooding, weakening the finances of the administration, and, in 1787, a bad harvest and jump in rice price caused a peasant's revolt.

sen.j: いわゆる天明の一揆であるが、これを皮切りにしてその後も火事などの災害が相次ぎ、藩内では打ちこわしや強訴が相次いで発生した。
sen.e: This was so-called a riot in the Tenmei period, and after that disaster such as fire occurred one after another, and destruction and direct petitions broke out in the domain.
This was the so-called "riot of the Tenmei period", and was followed by further disasters such as a series of fires in quick succession, and an outbreaks of violence and destruction in the domain.
This was the so-called riot of the Tenmei period, and was followed by further disasters such as a series of fires in quick succession, and an outbreaks of violence and destruction in the domain.

sen.j: このため、藩では煙草の専売制や木材の市場移出制を中心とした藩政改革を実施して効果を挙げている。
sen.e: In this context, the domain implemented monopolization of tabacco and the market transfer system of wood, and obtained effective results.
Under these circumstances, the domain adminstration implemented various reforms, including the monopolization of tobacco and a system for bringing timber to market, and these proved to be effective.
Under these circumstances, the domain administration implemented various reforms, including the monopolization of tobacco and a system for bringing timber to market, and these proved to be effective.

sen.j: 幕末期には早くから御所の警備を行なうなどして官軍側に帰順した。
sen.e: The domain returned to the side of the government army as it started the security of the old imperial palace early at the end of Edo Period.
At the end of the Edo period, the lords were involved with the security of the old imperial palace at an early stage and supported the government army.
At the end of the Edo period, the lords were involved with the security of the old imperial palace at an early stage and supported the government army.

sen.j: 明治2年（1869年）の版籍奉還で最後の藩主・小出英尚は藩知事となる。
sen.e: Hidenao KOIDE, the last lord of the domain, became the governor of the domain at the return of the lands and people to the emperor in 1869.
Hidenao KOIDE, the last lord of the domain, became the governor of the domain when the return of lands to the emperor was implemented in 1869.
Hidenao KOIDE, the last lord of the domain, became the governor of the domain when the return of lands to the emperor was implemented in 1869.

sen.j: 明治4年（1871年）7月の廃藩置県で園部藩は廃藩となったが、なおも英尚は園部県知事となった。
sen.e: The domain of Sonobe was abolished at the abolition of clans and establishment of prefectures in July 1871; however, Hidenao also took the position of the governor of Sonobe Prefecture.
The domain of Sonobe was abolished at the abolition of clans and establishment of prefectures in July 1871, but Hidenao then took the position of the governor of Sonobe Prefecture.
The domain of Sonobe was abolished at the abolition of domains and establishment of prefectures in July 1871, but Hidenao then took the position of the governor of Sonobe Prefecture.

sen.j: 園部県は同年8月に廃され、同年11月には京都府に編入されたのである。
sen.e: Sonobe Prefecture was abolished in August in that year, and incorporated into Kyoto Prefecture in November of the same year.
Sonobe Prefecture was abolished in August of the same year, and incorporated into Kyoto Prefecture that November.
Sonobe Prefecture was abolished in August of the same year, and incorporated into Kyoto Prefecture that November.

sen.j: なお、藩主家は、子爵に任じられた。
sen.e: The family of lord of the domain was appointed as a viscount.
The family of lord of the domain were givent the rank of viscount.
The family of lord of the domain were given the rank of viscount.

tit.e: List of lords of the domain in chronological order
The chronological order of the Lords.
tit.cmt: フィードバックにより統一しました。

sen.e: 29,800 koku to 25,000 koku to 24,000 koku.
29,800 koku, 25,000 koku, and subsequently 24,000 koku.
29,800 koku, 25,000 koku, and subsequently 24,000 koku.

sen.j: 外様。
sen.e: The outside daimyo.
The outside daimyo.
The tozama daimyo (the allied daimyo of the Tokugawa shogun)
sen.cmt: 他の記事に合わせました。

sen.j: 小出吉親（よしちか）【元和5年12月藩主就任－寛文7年6月9日隠居】
sen.e: Yoshichika KOIDE (assumed the lord of the domain on December 1619 - retired on June 9, 1667)
Yoshichika KOIDE (became the lord of the domain on December 1619 - retired on June 9, 1667)
sen.cmt: You assume a lordship, and become a lord.
sen.e: Yoshichika KOIDE (became the lord of the domain on December 1619 - retired on June 9, 1667)

sen.j: 小出英知（ふさとも）【寛文7年6月9日藩主就任－延宝元年（1673年）10月27日隠居】
sen.e: Fusatomo KOIDE (assumed the lord of the domain on June 9, 1667 - retired on October 27, 1673)
Fusatomo KOIDE (became the lord of the domain on June 9, 1667 - retired on October 27, 1673)
sen.cmt: You assume a lordship, and become a lord.
sen.e: Fusatomo KOIDE (became the lord of the domain on June 9, 1667 - retired on October 27, 1673)

sen.j: 小出英利（ふさとし）【延宝元年10月27日藩主就任－宝永2年（1705年）4月22日隠居】
sen.e: Fusatoshi KOIDE (assumed the lord of the domain on October 27, 1673 - retired on April 22, 1705)
Fusatoshi KOIDE (became the lord of the domain on October 27, 1673 - retired on April 22, 1705)
sen.cmt: You assume a lordship, and become a lord.
sen.e: Fusatoshi KOIDE (became the lord of the domain on October 27, 1673 - retired on April 22, 1705)

sen.j: 小出英貞（ふささだ）【宝永2年4月22日藩主就任－延享元年（1744年）11月19日死去】
sen.e: Fusasada KOIDE (assumed the lord of the domain on April 22, 1705 - died on November 19, 1744)
Fusasada KOIDE (became the lord of the domain on April 22, 1705 - died on November 19, 1744)
sen.cmt: You assume a lordship, and become a lord.
sen.e: Fusasada KOIDE (became the lord of the domain on April 22, 1705 - died on November 19, 1744)

sen.j: 小出英持（ふさよし）【延享元年12月26日藩主就任－明和4年（1767年）10月15日死去】
sen.e: Fusayoshi KOIDE (assumed the lord of the domain on December 26, 1744 - died on October 15, 1767)
Fusayoshi KOIDE (became the lord of the domain on December 26, 1744 - died on October 15, 1767)
sen.cmt: You assume a lordship, and become a lord.
sen.e: Fusayoshi KOIDE (became the lord of the domain on December 26, 1744 - died on October 15, 1767)

sen.j: 小出英常（ふさつね）【明和4年12月7日藩主就任－安永4年（1775年）9月29日死去】
sen.e: Fusatsune KOIDE (assumed the lord of the domain on December 7, 1767 - died on September 29, 1775)
Fusatsune KOIDE (became the lord of the domain on December 7, 1767 - died on September 29, 1775)
sen.cmt: You assume a lordship, and become a lord.
sen.e: Fusatsune KOIDE (became the lord of the domain on December 7, 1767 - died on September 29, 1775)

sen.j: 小出英タケ（ふさたけ）【安永4年11月24日藩主就任－文政4年（1821年）5月1日死去】
sen.e: Fusatake KOIDE (assumed the lord of the domain on November 24, 1775 - died on May 1, 1821)
Fusatake KOIDE (became the lord of the domain on November 24, 1775 - died on May 1, 1821)
sen.cmt: You assume a lordship, and become a lord.
sen.e: Fusatake KOIDE (became the lord of the domain on November 24, 1775 - died on May 1, 1821)

sen.j: 小出英発（ふさおき）【文政4年7月16日藩主就任－天保14年（1843年）9月20日隠居】
sen.e: Fusaoki KOIDE (assumed the lord of the domain on July 16, 1821 - retired on September 20, 1843)
Fusaoki KOIDE (became the lord of the domain on July 16, 1821 - retired on September 20, 1843)
sen.cmt: You assume a lordship, and become a lord.
sen.e: Fusaoki KOIDE (became the lord of the domain on July 16, 1821 - retired on September 20, 1843)

sen.j: 小出英教（ふさのり）【天保14年9月20日藩主就任－安政2年（1855年）10月10日死去】
sen.e: Fusanori KOIDE (assumed the lord of the domain on September 20, 1843 - died on October 10, 1855)
Fusanori KOIDE (became the lord of the domain on September 20, 1843 - died on October 10, 1855)
sen.cmt: You assume a lordship, and become a lord.
sen.e: Fusanori KOIDE (became the lord of the domain on September 20, 1843 - died on October 10, 1855)

sen.j: 小出英尚（ふさなお）【安政3年（1856年）3月28日藩主就任－明治4年（1871年）県知事免官】
sen.e: Fusanao KOIDE (assumed the lord of the domain on March 28, 1856 - dismissed from the governor in 1871)
Fusanao KOIDE (became the lord of the domain on March 28, 1856 - dismissed from the post of governor in 1871)
sen.cmt: You assume a lordship, and become a lord. Also changed "dismissed as governor" to "dismissed from the post of governer".
sen.e: Fusanao KOIDE (became the lord of the domain on March 28, 1856 - dismissed from the post of governor in 1871)
